list_definition.definition: a button near the front door of a house which you press to make a sound that tells the people inside that you are there

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I think I heard someone ring the doorbell.

list_ex_of_english: The boy was worried and within a few minutes the doorbell rang again.
Telephone ringing can be converted to a flashing light and doorbells can also incorporate a flashing light to attract the patient's attention.
Even now, in cities and seaside towns it is not uncommon to find houses with 12 or more names taped next to the doorbell.
I did not know who she was because the doorbells did not have names on them.
The householder is caught unawares by a ring of the doorbell.
Programme an entire seductive evening before your date's mobile all-purpose utility aid triggers the doorbell to ring.
The balance of the grant will be used to acquire items such as vibrating alarm clocks, flashing doorbells and specially designed modems.
